intro: Vismia pozuzoensis, commonly known as the Pozuzo vismia, is a small evergreen tree native to the humid lowland forests of Venezuela. It belongs to the family Clusiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and elliptical leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by bright red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. It thrives in shaded environments and is often found in secondary growth areas within its native range.
